channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Investors who bet on the economy are taking a very cautious approach, JPMorgan finds
item.description: Macro fund managers have lower equity beta, lower futures exposure and are shorter on index ETFs

item.title: The latest stock sell-off is just a rotation. Something bigger needs a trigger, says Citi.
item.description: Two days is not a trend says analysts Scott Chronert

item.title: Hedge-fund favorites are beating the market — and for the first time in three years, Tesla’s one of them.

item.title: As a nurse, I’ve witnessed people abuse their power of attorney. Here are the signs.
item.description: “Even if someone has millions of dollars in retirement, that won’t keep them from being trapped in the hospital.”

item.title: A U.K. retailer is having its worst day ever as PwC-audited company said it overstated profits.
item.description: WH Smith shares saw their worst day on record on Thursday after the retailer said it overstated profits in its North American arm.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.
